channel.title: Protein Folding on Zack's Notablog
channel.description: Recent content in Protein Folding on Zack's Notablog

item.title: Proteins can tune their folding to circadian rhythms
item.description: Proteins are central to biology. For the most part, proteins in the body are crucial for catalyzing reactions that carry out almost all of our biologial processes. For a protein to be useful, after it’s made by a ribosome, it needs to fold into a 3-dimensional structure that is unique to its sequence. Its been widely thought that every unique sequence corresponds to a single unique structure. However, in biology, there are always exceptions to the rule.
